q:
What is the value of $txt in the following Perl code:

my $txt = 'I am learning Perl';                    
$txt =~ /(\w+)$/;
In Perl, which of the following attributes contains information about DBI?
In Perl, which of the following is a matching operator that ignores cases?
In Perl, which of the following operations is used to split a string?
In Perl, which of the following commands is used to open the MAX file handle with existing MX file?
In Perl, which of the following is used for am or pm designation?

What is the output of the following Perl code:

 $x = 10;$result = ($x++) * 2;
 print($result);
In Perl, which of the following stores associative arrays that use a key value as an index instead of numerical indexes?

What is the output of the following Perl code:

print 'a';
BEGIN {
    print 'b';
}
sub foo {
    print 'c';
}

In Perl, which of the following are true for strftime patterns:

a) %A - Displays the abbreviated weekday name

b) %F - Equivalent to %y-%m-%d (ISO 8601 date format)

c) %H - Displays the hour as a decimal number using the 12-hour clock

d) %t - A tab character

e) %T - Displays the time using the 24-hour clock

What is the output of the following Perl code:

$prize=8; 
print "You spent $prize";
In Perl, which of the following functions returns the last element of an array?

In Perl, what does m denote in the following statement:

    $string =~ m/sought_text/;

What is the output of the following Perl code:

my $a = 123456;
my $b = 123_456;

if ($a == $b) {
    print "same";
} 
else {
    print "different";
}
In Perl, what does $dt->secular_era() return?

a.option: Returns a string containing either 'BCE' or 'CE', according to the year
Returns a string containing either 'BC' or 'AD', according to the year
Returns the names of months in a year
Returns the name of the current month

q:
What is the output of the following Perl code:

@days = ( "Tuesday", "Monday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday", "Sunday", "Wednesday");
print $days[-2];
print $days[-6];

In Perl, what will the @b array consist of?

my @a = (10, 5, 1);
my @b = sort @a;

What is the output of the following Perl code:

@var_abc = (1..9);
  print "@var_abc\n";

What is the output of the following Perl code:

$test = 2.3456;
{
my $test = 5;
print "Inside  block, $test = $test ";
print "Inside block, $:: test = $:: test ";
}
print "Outside the block, $test = $test ";
print "Outside the block, $:: test = $::test ";

a.option:
Inside block, $test = 5
Inside block, $::test = 2.3456
Outside the block, $test = 2.3456
Outside the block, $::test = 2.3456
Inside  block, 5 = 5 Inside block,  test =  test Outside the block, 2.3456 = 2.3456 Outside the block,  test = 2.3456

Inside block, $test = 4
Inside block, $::test = 2.3456
Outside the block, $test = 2.3456
Outside the block, $::test = 2.3456

Inside block, $test = 1
Inside block, $::test = 2.3456
Outside the block, $test = 2.3456
Outside the block, $::test = 2.3456

q:
What is the output of the following Perl code snippet:

$result = 4**3; 
print($result);
In Perl, which of the following is used to display the full name of a month?
Which of these is used to make Perl scripts executable on Linux?

What is the output of the following Perl code:

@days = qw/Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat/;
print $days[-6] ;
print $days[-6];

What is the output of the following Perl code snippet:

package X;
sub foo
{
print("Inside X::foo\n");
}
package Z;
@ISA = (X);
sub foo
{
print("Inside Z::foo\n");
}
package main;
Z->foo();
In Perl, which of the following retrieves the next key and value pair from a hash?

What is the output of the following Perl code:

@nums = (10..20);
print "Before - @nums\n";

splice(@nums, 15, 15, 21..25);
print "After - @nums\n";
In Perl, which of the following signs is used to represent arrays?
In Perl, which of the following is a primary data structure?

What will be the output of the following Perl code:

@numbers = (2, 3, 5, 6.3219, 1);
print "With interpolation: @numbers ";
print "Without interpolation: ", @numbers;
In Perl, which of the following functions is used to print the value of a list interpreted with additional format?
How does Perl represent plurals?

What is the output of the following Perl code:

$a = 1;
$b = 10;
$c = 100;
$result = $a + $c / $b;
print($result);
In Perl, what is ->?

a.option: It is a symbolic link used to link a variable to a new name.
It is a symbolic link used to link a file to a new name.
It is a link used to link a file to a variable.

q: In Perl, which of the following functions is used to close the directory handle DIRHANDLE?

What does the following Perl code do:

open (FH,"xyz");

a.option: Opens the file xyz for overwriting
Opens a document, namely xyz, for reading
Contains an error, so it won't compile
Opens the file xyz for appending

q: In Perl, what happens when the #! statement contains errors?

a.option: An error message is received from the shell.
An expression that can store the result of other expressions
A data space in the memory

q:
What is the output of the following Perl code:

my $a = (0, 1, 2);
print "$a\n";

Which of these rules must be followed by modules in Perl:

  1. The filename of a module must be the same as the package name.
  2. The filename of a package must always begin with a capital letter.
  3. All filenames must have the extension pm.
  4. If an object-oriented technique is not used, then the package must be derived from the Exporter class.
